channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Potholes on Moorehead Way, 16th November
item.description:
These potholes have been here for several months, and I recently got punctures in my bike tyres cycling into them at night, when they could not be seen. This is especially dangerous because buses stop to rest on Moorehead Way, so other road users have to carefully go around the buses, which sends them directly into the potholes. Thank you!
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Richmount Gardens, Blackheath
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More Dumped Furniture on Wheathill Road, 16th November
item.description:
A broken cabinet and drawer unit have been dumped yet again on the pavement at Wheathill Road. This spot is now hit with new flytips almost every single day, turning a public walkway into a mess. The council’s lack of action is simply allowing this to continue unchecked.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wheathill Road, Anerley, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Littering including human waste drug parafanalia and mattresses etc, 16th November
item.description:
The front garden of 61 Finsbury Park road contains mattresses, sofas, drug paraphernalia & human waste etc. The property is derelict; stuck in an ownership legal dispute. The side passage/ front garden attracts rough sleepers and adults with complex needs.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Finsbury Park Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Intrusive hoarding lighting on Armstrong Close, 16th November
item.description:
Hi, The lighting on the hoarding for Berkeley Homes is extremely bright: multiple red lights on the hoarding itself and bright white lights within the site, that are on throughout the night and cause a lot of illumination in our house (opposite the hoarding). I have written to Berkeley to try to get some information about the timeline for the hoarding's removal or to see if there can be any temporary solutions and improvements, but haven't received a response. I'd be very grateful if you were able to help us with this issue, even just to know the timeline. Thank you so much, Ed
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Armstrong Close, Kidbrooke
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Blocked drains Durham Rd, 16th November
item.description:
Almost every drain on Durham Rd between Durham Ave and Westmoreland Rd is completely blocked. Everytime it rains the road floods. These blockages are caused by the heaps of rotting leaves that are never cleared up. Driving a sweeper lorry down the middle of the street a couple times a week does not pick up anything….waste of time and money.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Durham Road, Shortlands, Bromley, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: New and extensive graffiti on Tennis center building, 16th November
item.description:
There seems to be new and fresh dripping graffiti on the tennis center building as pictured. This is a family area and frequented by many visitors to the park. It is a shame that this is allowed to sit there. Can the paint be used that is anti graffiti going forward?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Depot Street, Camberwell, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside No.2 Warmsworth, 16th November
item.description:
A man came yesterday to do the drains. He lifted the man hole cover and didn't put in down properly, it was flush to the paving. Now it's sticking up. I have a disabled, pensioner mother and it's a trip hazard.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pratt Street, Kentish Town, Camden Town, London Borough of Camden

item.title: AirBnB key holders attached to park wall and fence, 16th November
item.description:
Paddington Stteet Gardens. Top end of Ashland Place, near Moxon Street. Behind the recycling bins. There are a couple of key holders typically used for short term stays attache to wall and fence.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ashland Place, Marylebone, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Opposite the new build works entrance alongside the railway, 16th November
item.description:
The pavement around the entrance to the new build block has been well repaired. The main damage however is on the opposite side of the road where lorries parked/unloaded. The pavement is badly broken over a long stretch alongside the railway and especially dangerous as it is now covered in leaves.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Exeter Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: E bike abandoned, 16th November
item.description:
There is an e bike at the junction of Newlyn Road and Camborne Road. It has been there for several weeks and keeps falling over across the pavement. It is very hazardous for the elderly and people with buggys. Indeed it is dangerous for all pedestrians. Please remove asap. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Newlyn Road, Falconwood, London Borough of Bexley
Report on FixMyStreet
